description:
Hyposmocoma kahamanoa is a species of moth that belongs to the family Cosmopterigidae. It is endemic to the Hawaiian Islands, where it can be found on the island of Oahu.

This moth species is a small-sized lepidopteran, with a wingspan typically ranging from 8 to 12 millimeters. The forewings of Hyposmocoma kahamanoa are greyish-brown in color, often with indistinct patterns or markings. The hindwings are typically a paler shade of grey.

The larvae of Hyposmocoma kahamanoa are believed to be detritivores, feeding on decaying plant matter or other organic material found in their native Hawaiian habitats. The life cycle and specific ecological role of this species within the Hawaiian ecosystem are still not fully understood and require further research.

As an endemic species found only in the Hawaiian Islands, Hyposmocoma kahamanoa is of particular interest to lepidopterists and conservation biologists studying the unique biodiversity of the Hawaiian archipelago.
